text.div:
NameFlagsCard.TypeDescription & Constraints
BEVaccination 0..*ResourceA record of an immunization or vaccination
identifier 0..1IdentifierThe business identifier(s) for the vaccination entry
status 1..1codeThe status of this vaccination record entry
statusReason 0..1CodeableConceptThe reason for the status e.g. 'not completed because...'
Binding: Vaccination status reason Value Set (required): Belgium codes to describe reasons considered for status of vaccination actions, e.g. reasons for not administering vaccine

patient 1..1Reference(BePatient)The patient that received vaccination.
vaccineCode 1..1CodeableConceptThe vaccine code, typically identified by the diseas(s) it covers. For example MMR, HPV, Tetanus, DTPa
vaccinationDate[x] 0..1The date and time when the vaccination has been administered
vaccinationDateDateTimedateTime
vaccinationDateStringstring
vaccinationRequest 0..1Reference()The patient-specific order or recommendation for the vaccination
protocol 0..1Reference()The vaccination plan or protocol (not patient-specific) that this vaccination is fulfilling
type 1..1codeThe type of vaccination action - for example first dose or reinforcement.
sequenceNumber 0..1stringThe sequence number of an immunization - whether it is the first dose, or second dose...
reporter 1..1Reference(BePractitioner)The professional that recorded the administration of the vaccine
recorded 1..1dateTimeThe date and time when the administration of the vaccine was recorded
performer 1..1Reference(BePractitioner)The professional that administered the medication
route 0..1CodeableConceptThe route of administration.
administeredProduct 0..1BackboneElementThe details of the product that was administered.
product 1..1Reference()The actual product that was administered. This should be a produc code or a reference to an actual Medication resource
lotNumber 0..1stringThe lot number
expirationDate 0..1dateThe expiration date of the product.
location 0..1Reference()The location where the immunization is performed.
note 0..1AttachmentAdditional notes for the vaccination.

Documentation for this format

name: BEVaccination
description: This is the logical model of the patient's vaccination entries in an immunization or vaccination record. The patient vaccination record of several entries as modeled here.

element.short: A record of an immunization or vaccination
element.definition: A record of an immunization or vaccination

element.short: Logical id of this artifact
element.definition: The logical id of the resource, as used in the URL for the resource. Once assigned, this value never changes.
element.comment: The only time that a resource does not have an id is when it is being submitted to the server using a create operation.

element.short: Metadata about the resource
element.definition: The metadata about the resource. This is content that is maintained by the infrastructure. Changes to the content might not always be associated with version changes to the resource.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: A set of rules under which this content was created
element.definition: A reference to a set of rules that were followed when the resource was constructed, and which must be understood when processing the content. Often, this is a reference to an implementation guide that defines the special rules along with other profiles etc.
element.comment: Asserting this rule set restricts the content to be only understood by a limited set of trading partners. This inherently limits the usefulness of the data in the long term. However, the existing health eco-system is highly fractured, and not yet ready to define, collect, and exchange data in a generally computable sense. Wherever possible, implementers and/or specification writers should avoid using this element. Often, when used, the URL is a reference to an implementation guide that defines these special rules as part of it's narrative along with other profiles, value sets, etc.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.isModifierReason: This element is labeled as a modifier because the implicit rules may provide additional knowledge about the resource that modifies it's meaning or interpretation

element.short: Language of the resource content
element.definition: The base language in which the resource is written.
element.comment: Language is provided to support indexing and accessibility (typically, services such as text to speech use the language tag). The html language tag in the narrative applies  to the narrative. The language tag on the resource may be used to specify the language of other presentations generated from the data in the resource. Not all the content has to be in the base language. The Resource.language should not be assumed to apply to the narrative automatically. If a language is specified, it should it also be specified on the div element in the html (see rules in HTML5 for information about the relationship between xml:lang and the html lang attribute).

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: The business identifier(s) for the vaccination entry
element.definition: The business identifier(s) for the vaccination entry - This is an optional attribute, used for example to track an entry throughout its lifecycle, or across vaults.

element.short: The status of this vaccination record entry
element.definition: The status of the vaccination record entry - whether it is active, entered in error, etc.

element.short: The reason for the status e.g. 'not completed because...'
element.definition: Supporting reason for status information.

binding.description: Belgium codes to describe reasons considered for status of vaccination actions, e.g. reasons for not administering vaccine

element.short: The patient that received vaccination.
element.definition: The patient that has received the vaccination.

element.short: The vaccine code, typically identified by the diseas(s) it covers. For example MMR, HPV, Tetanus, DTPa
element.definition: The vaccine code - a type of vaccine, typically identified by the disease(s) it covers. For example MMR, HPV, Tetanus, DTPa. This should be a coded value.

element.short: The date and time when the vaccination has been administered
element.definition: The date and/or time when the vaccine administration has been administered or presumed to be administered

element.short: The patient-specific order or recommendation for the vaccination
element.definition: The patient-specific order or recommendation for the vaccination, for example a prescription or a request for vaccination for a patient by a physician, for example for optional vaccines.

element.short: The vaccination plan or protocol (not patient-specific) that this vaccination is fulfilling
element.definition: The vaccination plan or protocol (not patient-specific) that this vaccination is fulfilling. For example 'Basisvaccinatieschema'

element.short: The type of vaccination action - for example first dose or reinforcement.
element.definition: The type of vaccination action - for example first dose or reinforcement.

element.short: The sequence number of an immunization - whether it is the first dose, or second dose...
element.definition: The sequence number of an immunization when part of a protocol - if it is the first dose, or second dose...

element.short: The professional that recorded the administration of the vaccine
element.definition: The professional that recorded the administration of the vaccine.

element.short: The date and time when the administration of the vaccine was recorded
element.definition: The date and time when the administration of the vaccine was recorded - typically used when the vaccine event is recorded a posteriori.

element.short: The professional that administered the medication
element.definition: The professional that administered the medication. Use code "unknown" if not known.

element.short: The route of administration.
element.definition: The route of administration for the vaccine. This can be free text (not desired) or a code

element.short: The details of the product that was administered.
element.definition: The details of the product that was administered

element.short: The actual product that was administered. This should be a produc code or a reference to an actual Medication resource
element.definition: The actual product that was administered. This can be just text (not desired), or a code (e.g. 1696392 = Neisvac C Dos 0,5ml) or a reference to an actual Medication product (e.g. http://server/Medication/1696392)
element.comment: In the case where the product is not known, use code "unknown"

element.short: The lot number
element.definition: The lot number

element.short: The expiration date of the product.
element.definition: The expiration date of the product.

element.short: The location where the immunization is performed.
element.definition: The location where the immunization administration was performed. This can be a text (e.g. 'at the physician's office' or a code e.g. '00078' meaning 'patient's home' or a resource (Location) if one exists e.g. 'Location/kind-en-gezin-092375' which could be defining 'Kind en Gezin Gent Koepoortkaai'

element.short: Additional notes for the vaccination.
element.definition: Additional notes for the vaccination

element.short: A record of an immunization or vaccination
element.definition: A record of an immunization or vaccination

element.definition: The business identifier(s) for the vaccination entry - This is an optional attribute, used for example to track an entry throughout its lifecycle, or across vaults.

element.definition: The route of administration for the vaccine. This can be free text (not desired) or a code

element.comment: In the case where the product is not known, use code "unknown"
